page.title: 16THE FORESTRY AT PONTSTICILL
page.content: Much of the land surrounding Pontsticill reservoir is owned by the Forestry Commision.The coniferous trees were originally planted by the Water Board to provide a shelter belt around the reservoir.Conifers were chosen in preference to deciduous trees as they shed a fine carpet of needles as opposed to a thick covering of broad leaves which would have found their way into the reservoir and tainted the water.At present the Forestry Commision provide facilities for tourists in the form of picnic areas overlooking the reservoirs and well sign posted tracks along which one can walk and admire the scenery.The Commision is constantly improving its facilities and in one area provides a Forest Centre with visitor information and a gift shop.
